event.doc_name: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: On Friday, June 6, 2025, Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) officers carried out enforcement actions at multiple locations within Los Angeles County and the City of Los Angeles.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: On Friday, June 6, 2025, Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) officers carried out enforcement actions at multiple locations within Los Angeles County and the City of Los Angeles.

evidence.text: Prior to the ICE operations, federal officials did not provide the leadership of the Los Angeles Sheriff's Department (LASD) or Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) with any notice as to the planned operations.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Prior to the ICE operations, federal officials did not provide the leadership of the Los Angeles Sheriff's Department (LASD) or Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) with any notice as to the planned operations.

evidence.text: During the course of these operations, ICE and its agents reportedly took actions that inflamed tensions and provoked protest.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: During the course of these operations, ICE and its agents reportedly took actions that inflamed tensions and provoked protest.

evidence.text: In all, the Department of Homeland Security reported that its enforcement activities on Friday, June 6, resulted in the arrest of approximately 44 individuals and 70‑80 people detained in total.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: In all, the Department of Homeland Security reported that its enforcement activities on Friday, June 6, resulted in the arrest of approximately 44 individuals and 70‑80 people detained in total.

evidence.text: That same day, members of the public gathered in protest at the Edward R. Roybal Federal Building and U.S. Courthouse.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: That same day, members of the public gathered in protest at the Edward R. Roybal Federal Building and U.S. Courthouse.

evidence.text: While not unified in their views or tactics, most protesters seemed to have gathered to express their opposition to the manner in which the Trump Administration has executed its immigration agenda.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: While not unified in their views or tactics, most protesters seemed to have gathered to express their opposition to the manner in which the Trump Administration has executed its immigration agenda.

evidence.text: During the protests, Service Employees International Union California leader David Huerta was injured in the midst of interactions with federal agents.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: During the protests, Service Employees International Union California leader David Huerta was injured in the midst of interactions with federal agents.

evidence.text: Protests continued on June 7 and June 8, 2025.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Protests continued on June 7 and June 8, 2025.

evidence.text: Most of those involved in protesting have been exercising their rights under the First Amendment in a peaceful, non‑violent, and legally compliant manner.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Most of those involved in protesting have been exercising their rights under the First Amendment in a peaceful, non‑violent, and legally compliant manner.

evidence.text: At no point in the past three days has there been a rebellion or an insurrection.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: At no point in the past three days has there been a rebellion or an insurrection.

evidence.text: Both the Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) and Los Angeles Sheriff Department (LASD) have substantial training and experience responding to protests and large‑scale riots.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Both the Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) and Los Angeles Sheriff Department (LASD) have substantial training and experience responding to protests and large‑scale riots.

evidence.text: In the afternoon of June 6, 2025, some time after protesters had gathered near the Roybal Federal Building and its “B‑18” detention facility, federal agents sent a request to LAPD for assistance.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: In the afternoon of June 6, 2025, some time after protesters had gathered near the Roybal Federal Building and its “B‑18” detention facility, federal agents sent a request to LAPD for assistance.

evidence.text: The Governor communicated unequivocally and publicly on social media that he disapproved of the federal government’s plans.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: The Governor communicated unequivocally and publicly on social media that he disapproved of the federal government’s plans.

evidence.text: On the evening of June 7, President Trump issued a memorandum entitled “Department of Defense Security for the Protection of Department of Homeland Security Functions” (the Trump Memo).
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: On the evening of June 7, President Trump issued a memorandum entitled “Department of Defense Security for the Protection of Department of Homeland Security Functions” (the Trump Memo).

evidence.text: The Trump Memo does not identify the Los Angeles protests, the State, or any specific geographic region by name, but instead refers to “numerous incidents of violence and disorder” that “have recently occurred and threaten to continue in response” to ICE enforcement of federal immigration laws and to threats to the security of federal immigration detention facilities and other federal property.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: The Trump Memo does not identify the Los Angeles protests, the State, or any specific geographic region by name, but instead refers to “numerous incidents of violence and disorder” that “have recently occurred and threaten to continue in response” to ICE enforcement of federal immigration laws and to threats to the security of federal immigration detention facilities and other federal property.

evidence.text: The Trump Memo states: “In light of these incidents and credible threats of continued violence, by the authority vested in me as President by the Constitution and the laws of the United States.”
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: The Trump Memo states: “In light of these incidents and credible threats of continued violence, by the authority vested in me as President by the Constitution and the laws of the United States.”

evidence.text: The Trump Memo further directs the Secretary of Defense to coordinate with the Governors of the States and the National Guard Bureau in identifying and ordering into Federal service the appropriate members and units of the National Guard under this authority.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: The Trump Memo further directs the Secretary of Defense to coordinate with the Governors of the States and the National Guard Bureau in identifying and ordering into Federal service the appropriate members and units of the National Guard under this authority.

evidence.text: Early on Saturday, June 7, Border Czar Tom Homan stated “Mayor [Karen] Bass should be thanking us…”
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Early on Saturday, June 7, Border Czar Tom Homan stated “Mayor [Karen] Bass should be thanking us…”

evidence.text: The Trump Memo specifies that the members and units called into federal services “shall be at least 2,000 National Guard personnel and the duration of duty shall be for 60 days or at the discretion of the Secretary of Defense.”
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: The Trump Memo specifies that the members and units called into federal services “shall be at least 2,000 National Guard personnel and the duration of duty shall be for 60 days or at the discretion of the Secretary of Defense.”

doc_names: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order

evidence.text: The President Lawfully Federalized the National Guard.
evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order

add_extracted.value: The President Lawfully Federalized the National Guard.

evidence.text: The necessary conditions existed for the President’s order
evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order

add_extracted.value: The necessary conditions existed for the President’s order.

evidence.text: Section 12406 does not require a governor’s consent or input.
evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order

add_extracted.value: Section 12406 does not require a governor’s consent or input.

evidence.text: The President lacks authority to federalize the State National Guard
evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order

add_extracted.value: The President lacks authority to federalize the State National Guard.

evidence.text: Section 12406 expressly empowers the President to call the California National Guard into federal service when he considers it necessary to quell a rebellion or when he determines that regular forces are unable to execute federal law.
evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order

add_extracted.value: Section 12406 expressly empowers the President to call the California National Guard into federal service when he considers it necessary to quell a rebellion or when he determines that regular forces are unable to execute federal law.

evidence.text: The President’s unlawful order calling into Federal service members and units of the National Guard under 10 U.S.C. § 12406.
evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order

add_extracted.value: The President’s unlawful order calling into Federal service members and units of the National Guard under 10 U.S.C. § 12406.

evidence.text: On Friday June 6, 2025, protestors threw bottles, concrete chunks, and other objects at FPS officers.
evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order

add_extracted.value: On Friday June 6, 2025, protestors threw bottles, concrete chunks, and other objects at FPS officers.

evidence.text: The protestors used large rolling commercial dumpsters as a battering ram to breach the parking garage gate.
evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order

add_extracted.value: The protestors used large rolling commercial dumpsters as a battering ram to breach the parking garage gate.

evidence.text: The protestors were using chairs, pepper balls, and other items as weapons.
evidence.source_document: Defendants' Corrected Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for a Temporary Restraining Order

add_extracted.value: The protestors were using chairs, pepper balls, and other items as weapons.
